TopicTitle: USAF Chemical Corps - F-15K - Kraken II - Armed with MK116 Binary Bombs

Articles.Content:
Settle a score with any aggressive nation in one airstrike.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/7yoseh9izrwnegt/F-15F-2%20Zed%202%20Dumb%20Bomber.craft?dl=0

The MK116 Weteye armed F-15 Kraken II. In clean configuration with all bombs expended, the jet cruises at 220 m/s at sea level, and can turn at 10 G's with a sustained 180-220 M/S, which shows the excellent energy keeping properties of the airframe.

Droppable fuel tanks are available upon request. The configuration in the craft here has 6 binary sarin Weteye bombs.

Future weapons under development for the USAF Chemical Arsenal include the M-55 binary agent VX missiles for increased retaliatory potential.

Deploying the Sarin Bomblets.

The "Evil Empire" must fall. The Iron curtain will

Edited February 11, 2015 by andrew123
Great job. I love the F-15. I suggest making external fuel tanks for it. In reality it has a fairly low internal fuel capacity and relies on them for longer flights and prolonged supersonic flight.

Great job. I love the F-15. I suggest making external fuel tanks for it. In reality it has a fairly low internal fuel capacity and relies on them for longer flights and prolonged supersonic flight.

My previous block F-15 had external fuel tanks. This F-15 had them removed in favor of more chemical weapons payload.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

If I really wanted to, I could add a midair refueling module. I've already got a prototype KC-135 in the works.

Midair refueling was possible long ago. This old picture proves that.

That's an old refueling run with my long retired recon bird.
